block.p: Susan Malka Choi, the daughter of Vivian Choi of Houston and Dr. Chang Choi of South Bend, Ind., was married yesterday to Peter Andrew Wells, the son of Shirley and Raymond Wells of Cotuit, Mass. Mayor Ann R. Morgan of Hawley, Pa., officiated at Indian Head Camp, near Honesdale, Pa.

Ms. Choi, 34, is keeping her name. She teaches fiction writing in the graduate school at Brooklyn College and is also the author of a novel, ''The Foreign Student'' (HarperCollins, 1998). She graduated from Yale and received a Master of Fine Arts degree in creative writing from Cornell. Her father is a professor of mathematics at Indiana University at South Bend. Her mother retired as an administrative secretary at Rice University in Houston.

Susan Choi, Peter Wells Susan Malka Choi, the daughter of Vivian Choi of Houston and Dr. Chang Choi of South Bend, Ind., was married yesterday to Peter Andrew Wells, the son of Shirley and Raymond Wells of Cotuit,Mass. Mayor Ann R. Morgan of Hawley, Pa., officiated at Indian Head Camp, near Honesdale, Pa.

Susan Malka Choi, the daughter of Vivian Choi of Houston and Dr. Chang Choi of South Bend, Ind., was married yesterday to Peter Andrew Wells, the son of Shirley and Raymond Wells of Cotuit, Mass. Mayor Ann R. Morgan of Hawley, Pa., officiated at Indian Head Camp, near Honesdale, Pa.

Ms. Choi, 34, is keeping her name. She teaches fiction writing in the graduate school at Brooklyn College and is also the author of a novel, ''The Foreign Student'' (HarperCollins, 1998). She graduated from Yale and received a Master of Fine Arts degree in creative writing from Cornell. Her father is a professor of mathematics at Indiana University at South Bend. Her mother retired as an administrative secretary at Rice University in Houston.

Mr. Wells, 39, is a senior editor at Details magazine in Manhattan. His mother is the executive director of Plymouth Crossings, an assisted living community in Plymouth, Mass. His father retired as an electrical engineer in Worcester, Mass., with the New England Electric System, a public utility.
